channel.title: Making co owners
channel.description: Well I am the owner of nolan-pkz.no-ip.biz um well i have a frind that has owner but i wunt him to be co owner im nto much of a coder so i was wondering if u could help me out? thanks alot XD

item.title: Making co owners
item.dc:creator: @brovolll brovolll
item.description:
@brovolll wrote:

[quote=“Java Is My Bitch, post:6, topic:219981”]No such thing as Co-Owner and Owner.

Owner = you have possession of the files.

Co-Owner = You helped out,(might have possession of the files)

There are no certain rights.

Either 1 or 2, anything higher is the same. THOUGH you can pretend that 3 is owner, and you can give him 2 and give yourself 3 and make the proper arrangements to the things that are owner and what are admin.[/quote] thats true no such thing as co-owner… ur trying to say that some one that could change ur source and edit client etc… no there no such thing bbuddy co-owner is anther persone in sevrer that has same rights as you…

Read full topic

item.title: Making co owners
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

erm, owner and co owner can exist… actualy owner does exist in most sources already.

codes in your client are set to something like

if playerRights >=3 yada yada

they are already in most sources for codes such as ip banning and ownerglow and stuff.

if u want to make co owners, just make codes with something like

if playerRights == 4 or something… whatever you want Co-owner rights number to be. just be sure that whoever you make co owner to put their player rights to that number in their character file to match the code in the client…

-----also, very important and nice to know while coding player rights required commands…
did u notice the >=, <=, and == in your codes?

<= means the requirements are less than or eaqual to the number you put after it.

= means greater than or equal to the number

== means it has to be that number of rights.

Read full topic

item.title: Making co owners
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

No such thing as Co-Owner and Owner.

Owner = you have possession of the files.

Co-Owner = You helped out,(might have possession of the files)

There are no certain rights.

Either 1 or 2, anything higher is the same. THOUGH you can pretend that 3 is owner, and you can give him 2 and give yourself 3 and make the proper arrangements to the things that are owner and what are admin.

Read full topic
